How to treat plantar fasciitis?

Plantar fasciitis, a common cause of heel pain occurs when a part of the foot called the plantar fascia gets irritated. The plantar fascia is a tough band of tissue that connects the heel bone to the toes. Plantar fasciitis can occur from wearing poor footwear, running, jumping or standing or walking for long periods of time.

🧑‍⚕️ Treatment
🪑 First step is rest, avoid excessive and repetitive heel impact from jumping, dancing, and distance running.
🧊 Icing the area can also help. 
🧘 Stretching exercises can also help:
- Calf-plantar fascia stretch: Sit with your legs straight and loop a towel around your foot. Then pull the top part of your foot towards you. Hold it like that for 10 to 30 seconds. Repeat this multiple times per day.
- Root/ankle circles: With foot in the air (can rest on a chair for comfort) point and flex your foot. Then make circles with your foot by rotating your ankle.
- Toe curls: Curl your toes around a towel. Then grip and release the towel over and over again for 1-2 minutes. Do this twice a day.
👟 Supportive footwear with arch support 

🧑‍⚕️ Prognosis
Most of the time, plantar fasciitis resolves with these conservatives measures, but if it continues, please see your care provider.

I found the stretching exercises and rest helped resolve my plantar fasciitis. Anything else you have found helpful?

🧼 Should you use soaps to wash your vagina?

🛑 No! 

Avoid washing your vagina with harsh soaps or douching. There is good bacteria in our vagina called lactobacilli that keeps the vagina healthy. Washing or douching can hurt the good bacteria and increase your risk of infections such as bacterial vaginosis. 

A mild soap or cleanser can be used externally to clean the vulva. The vulva includes all of the external genitalia, including the labia majora, labia minora, glans clitoris and urethra.

April is Oral Cancer Awareness month. Sadly, every hour someone dies of oral or oropharyngeal cancer (cancer of the back of the oral cavity and upper throat). Yet if oral cancer is detected and treated early, treatment-related health problems are reduced, and survival rates may increase.

ORAL CANCER screening is incredibly important, and should be conducted routinely by your dentist as part of your annual dental check up.

The average age of people diagnosed with these cancers is 64, but they can occur in young people. Just over 20% (1 in 5) of cases occur in people younger than 55 (American Cancer Society).

Risk factors for oral cancer include:
🛑Tobacco use.
🛑Drinking alcohol.
🛑 Betel Nut.
🛑Human papillomavirus (HPV) infection - for oropharyngeal cancer.
🛑Excess body weight.
🛑Older age.
🛑Ultraviolet (UV) light.
🛑Poor nutrition.

EARLY RECOGNITION of oral soft tissue changes, are KEY to early diagnosis and treatment to significantly improve your prognosis and outcome. 

Your oral soft tissues are evaluated regularly at your routine check up, and at any time you have dental treatment 🦷.

We do this by screening for any change of colour or texture in the tissues of your cheek and jaws, assessing for lesions in the back of your mouth and throat by having you open wide and SAY AHH 😲and by sticking your tongue out to check its side and at its base 😛

Talk to your dentist at your next check up about how to reduce your RISK factors for oral cancer and ensure you are screened annually.

🥛 Does drinking milk increase mucus production?

No! A study published in 2011 showed no increase in phlegm production.

🥛 In fact:
* Milk consumption and phlegm production among people with the common cold in a clinical study showed no increased phlegm associated with drinking milk.
* Self-reported problems with mucus were the same between two study groups — one drinking milk and another drinking soy milk.

🥛 The reasons some may note a change in the mucus after drinking milk is that milk and saliva in your create a somewhat thick liquid that can briefly coat the mouth and throat. The sensation that lingers may be mistaken for increased phlegm.

Reference: Milk consumption does not lead to mucus production or occurrence of asthma. J Am Coll Nutr. 2005 Dec;24(6 Suppl):547S-55S.

Balancing work life 🧑‍⚕️ and mom life 👩 👧🏻 👦🏻 

Before I became a mom I thought I could balance these two roles perfectly. With having a 6 year old and 3 year old, I now realize that it is impossible to balance these roles perfectly. There have been times that I have let colleagues down because I have to attend to my family, and also times that I’ve missed important family activities because of work. I particularly felt torn during my first year of motherhood.

One thing that has positively changed for me over the years is my outlook and expectations of myself. I have let go of the concept that I need try to balance things perfectly and instead now focus on what I am doing at the time. For example, when I’m at work I’m focused on my patients and trying to be the best doctor that I can be. When I am at home, I am engaging with my kids and creating amazing memories together.

On days I am really tired from work, I’ve lowered my expectations of myself. We have frozen pizza or do takeout. When my kids ask for movie night and we are all tired, we do movie night and chill.

By realizing that I don’t need to balance both aspects of my life perfectly, I took the pressure off myself I am now able to enjoy both roles more and feel fortunate to have a fulfilling career that I love and also a family that I love very much.

Share your thoughts with me👇

Should you worry if your 12 month old is not walking?👇

Each baby will learn to coordinate and balance at different rates! Some babies will learn to walk at 8 months while others may start closer to 18 months. There is a wide range of normal! That being said, we do recommend that you check in with your care provider if your little one is not walking by 18 months or earlier if your 12 month old is displaying any of the following: 

🛑 The presence of any other delays (speech, fine motor or feeding)
🛑 No form of independent mobility (e.g. crawling, bottom shuffle)
🛑 Not pulling to stand
🛑 Only using one side of body
🛑 Unable to sit independently without support
🛑 Standing with with marked abnormal foot position (e.g. intoeing)

When I became a new mom, I had a few friends and family members make comments that were meant to be well-meaning but were hurtful to me. These are some of the comments that I think should be avoided:
🛑 “You look tired” - I was more tired postpartum than I had ever been as a medical resident. I knew I was exhausted, but having others tell me that I looked exhausted made me feel even worse. It would have been kinder to hear “Can I help you and watch the baby for a few hours?”
🛑 “Your a bad mom if you are not breastfeeding” - Although I did not hear this exact statement I remember feeling like a failure because I was struggling with breastfeeding. I had difficulty getting my daughter to latch and felt that breast milk is the best form of nutrition and that I would be giving her the best opportunity to grow healthy if I was able to breastfeed. I would have preferred to hear “I can see how hard you are trying to breastfeed, let us connect you with a lactation consultant. If you aren’t able to breastfeed, formula is another safe and healthy option.”
🛑 “When I had a baby...” - Unsolicited advice comes from a good place but it can be annoying! In most cases, I would have preferred if I didn’t get advice unless I asked for it.
🛑 “How much weight did you gain during pregnancy?” - I remember feeling very insecure about my body postpartum. I gained 60 pounds during my pregnancy and felt pressure to “bounce back.” When I was asked this I  felt even more pressure to return to my pre-pregnancy weight. After speaking to a friend and colleague I realized that it was most important to prioritize emotional and physical health over body shape. Now with my postpartum patients I tell them to be kind to themselves and listen to their own needs and pace themselves.

Should you worry if you’re snoring in your sleep?😴

Snoring is caused by vibrations of the tissue in the throat during sleep. Snoring may be a sign of obstructive sleep apnea, which is a sleep disorder where the airway is narrowing while breathing. This can contribute to poor quality sleep and sleep problems. Untreated sleep apnea can increase the risk serious medical conditions such as diabetes and heart disease.

The main symptoms of sleep apnea are loud snoring, tiredness, and daytime sleepiness. Other symptoms can include:
😴 Waking up choking or gasping
😴 Morning headaches
😴 Impaired memory
😴 Feeling restless or groggy
😴 Restless sleep

If you think you have obstructive sleep apnea please see your care provider so they can send you for a sleep study to diagnose sleep apnea.

Ever wonder how to get passport photos for newborns?

This is our son George at his first passport photos. He was 7 weeks old. After 2 rejected photos, we started to feel it was impossible. We found the the most challenging aspects of getting a passport photo for a newborn were: 
👶🏻The baby’s entire face must be visible and square to the camera, not tilted.
👶🏻The baby’s eyes must be open
👶🏻Neutral expression (ie. not crying)
There are other requirements but these were the hardest for our son George. His eyes would close or he would be crying!

On our third trip to get passport photos with the help of passport photo experts, we did the following:
❇️Improved our timing. We ensured Georgie had a nap prior to getting his photo taken.
❇️Brought a soother that could be placed in his mouth just prior to the photo.
❇️Brought a toy he enjoyed and we used it to keep his eyes open and alert. 

👶🏻Is there anything else you found helpful for newborn passport photos?

What are seasonal allergies? 🤧 

Seasonal allergies occur when the body’s immune system overreacts to something in the environment. Seasonal allergies, as their name implies, only occur during certain times of the year. Most often seasonal allergies occur in the spring  because seasonal allergies are most commonly triggered by pollen. Pollen is released by trees, grasses and weeds the spring when plants start to bloom and release pollen into the air. Grasses and weeds also produce pollen in the late spring and into the summer, which can also trigger allergies. 
 
Seasonal allergy affects approximately ¼ of the Canadian population. The risk of developing seasonal allergies is higher in people with asthma, or eczema and in people who have a family history of seasonal allergies. 
 
Seasonal allergies can occur at any age, but most people first develop symptoms in childhood or young adulthood. Some people can develop seasonal allergies later in life. The exact reason why people develop allergies later in life isn’t fully known but it is thought there could be changes in the immune system or increased exposure to allergens (such as moving to a new geographic region). 

It is possible to reduce symptoms of seasonal allergies by limiting your exposure to things that trigger allergy symptoms. Ways to reduce exposure to allergens include closing the windows of the car and home, staying indoors when possible, and using air conditioners to filter the air during times of peak symptoms. Using a high quality mask may be helpful for activities, such as grass cutting or wood cutting. Showering before bed removes allergens from hair and skin and can help reduce contamination of the bedding.

Some people with seasonal allergies may also need medications such as antihistamines and  nasal steroid sprays in combination with reducing exposures to allergens. 

Do you have seasonal allergies?

What is vernix and how does it protect your baby?👶🏻

At birth babies are covered in vernix. Vernix is a waxy whitish substance that covers the baby during the last trimester of pregnancy. It acts as a natural moisturizer, acts as a barrier to prevent water loss, helps with temperature regulation and may have anti-bacterial properties.

In fact, there are studies to suggest that he vernix helps the baby’s skin adapt to the first week postnatally if not washed off. The World Health Organization recommends delaying the first bath for 24 hours.

I used to think being vulnerable was a weakness, but as I’ve gotten older, I now realize that it is a strength. 

By being vulnerable, you allow yourself to show your true selves, including your fears, insecurities, and emotions. Being vulnerable with others has allowed me to build authentic connections by creating an atmosphere of trust and understanding. 

Being vulnerable with yourself forces you to self-reflect and consequently get to better understand your own emotions, strengths, and areas for growth. 

I also think that once we open up about our vulnerabilities it allows others to relate to us and share their own experiences. Everyone has struggles and imperfections. Vulnerability creates space for support and connection with others. It takes courage to be vulnerable, as it means risking potential judgment or rejection. Embracing vulnerability demonstrates inner strength and resilience. It involves facing our fears and stepping outside of our comfort zones to grow personally and emotionally. Being vulnerable helps communication by promoting honest dialogue and encourages others to do the same. 

That being said, it is important to discern when it is appropriate to be vulnerable and to whom you show your vulnerability. I don’t show my vulnerability in every situation or with everyone, but over the years I have learned to be more vulnerable to those close to me.

What two foods should be introduced by 4-6 months of age?

🥜 🥚 Peanuts and Eggs

Early introduction of peanuts around 6 months of age can reduce the risk of peanut allergies later on in life (LEAP Study). There is also some data suggesting that introduction of eggs around 6 months may be beneficial in reducing egg allergy.

I introduced peanuts to my babes by mixing a teaspoon or two of smooth peanut butter mixed with warm water, breast milk or with infant cereal. My daughter really liked peanut butter in her infant cereal!

I introduced eggs to my babes by boiling and egg and then mashing it in very small pieces. My mom and grandmother introduced eggs to me as a Chinese style egg custard. There are many different ways to make this custard, our family stirs the raw egg and add a little water and let the bubbles settle and then steam it until it’s cooked through (about 8 min for one egg).

How did you introduce peanuts and eggs to your baby?

Is maple syrup healthy?👇
 
Compared to refined sugars such as corn syrup or white sugar, maple syrup is preferable as it has a higher concentration of minerals such as manganese and zinc. Zinc helps support our immune system, while manganese plays a crucial role in fat and carbohydrate metabolism, calcium absorption, blood sugar regulation, brain and nerve function.

Maple syrup also contains many types of antioxidants. These antioxidants may be beneficial for reducing risk of chronic diseases such as inflammatory arthritis and cardiovascular disease.

Some studies also suggest many of these antioxidants may help reduce the growth of cancer cells. However, it’s important to note that this study did not involve humans and more studies need to be done in this area.

Compared to corn syrup and brown rice syrup, maple syrup has a lower glycemic index. This means it is less likely to cause spikes in your blood sugar and raise insulin levels than refined sugars.

🧑‍⚕️So should we be eating more maple syrup?

Making maple syrup your preferred sugar when choosing to sweeten foods such as coffee, baked goods or homemade salad dressings may offer more benefit than other sugar options. However, it is important to remember we must be conscientious of the amount of added sugars we consume. Consumed in excess, sugar may be a leading cause of some of the world’s biggest health problems, including obesity, type 2 diabetes and heart disease. Maple syrup is in fact 66% sugar! Calorie for calorie, maple syrup is a very poor source of nutrients compared to whole foods like vegetables, fruits and unprocessed animal foods. Remember the best way to get minerals and antioxidants is to eat a wide variety of whole foods! 

Thoughts/questions👇

🎥 @rachelschoutsen @weathernetwork

In Canada, based on the Canadian Task Force on Preventive Health Care (CTFPHC) screening for cervical cancer with a Pap test should begin when sexually active and age 25. Other countries screening guidelines may differ.

Cervical cancer is a type of cancer that starts in the cervix (the lower part of the uterus). Screening for cervical cancer is done with a Pap test to identify abnormal changes in the cells of your cervix caused by viruses such as Human Papilloma Virus (HPV). Screening is important as it will allow for early detection which can prevent the abnormal cells from developing into cancer.

In Canada, it is not recommended to perform Pap tests on individuals who have not been sexually active. Sexual activity can be vaginal intercourse, vaginal‐oral sex, vaginal‐digital sex or sharing of sex toys or devices. Pap tests are completed on individuals who are, or have ever been sexually actively as HPV is spread by sexual contact. 

Share your thoughts, questions 👇

Why using Q-tips in your ear can be dangerous?

Using Q-tips in your ear can:
👂 Damage the ear drum.
👂 Push wax even deeper in.
👂 Irritate the ear canal.
👂 The cotton from the Q-tip can get stuck in the ear canal.

At a party yesterday, our friend explained that while cleaning her ear the end of the Q-tip got stuck in her ear. She tried to remove it herself but this lead to pain, and the cotton tip being pushed even further into the ear canal. My husband @graememulhollandmd is an Ear Nose and Throat Surgeon and was able to remove the cotton tip from her ear. We then advised that Q-tips should not be used in the ear and she asked, “So how do I clean the inside of my ear?”

The wax in our ears will often come out anyways as the ear has a self cleaning mechanism where wax and other debris will come out of the ear on its own. That being said, there are some people who have significant amounts of ear wax accumulation for a variety of reasons such as drier and thicker ear wax. To soften the ear wax, we recommend using drops of mineral oil (baby oil) with an eye dropper to ear canal to soften wax.

For those with a significant amount of ear was accumulation it can lead to hearing problems. If you are experiencing hearing loss or ear pain, please see your care provider as wax accumulation can be a potential cause. If your care provider sees a significant amount of wax in your ear, healthcare provider can use instruments specifically designed to remove earwax.

Have you experienced problems with Q-tips?

Why is allergy season getting worse? 🤧 

Climate change and warmer temperatures can lead to a longer and more severe allergy season. This is because warmer temperatures lead to a longer growing season for plants such as trees, grasses and weeds. Trees, grasses and weeds release pollen, and pollen is the most common trigger of seasonal allergies. In addition, the rising carbon dioxide emissions encourages plants to grow more and produce more pollen.

Do women have more difficulty sleeping than men?
 
In general yes 🛌.

Women are more likely to have insomnia which means difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep or getting good quality sleep. Women’s sleep patterns can be influenced by various factors, such as hormonal changes during the menstrual cycle, pregnancy, and menopause. Hormones affect our sleep-wake cycle and can affect sleep quality and quantity. Women are more likely to wake in the middle of the night to care for others in the home, which results in interrupted sleep. Interrupted sleep leads to us getting less restorative REM sleep.

Sleep requirements vary from person to person, but for adults regardless of sex, it is recommended that we get 7-9 hours of sleep per night.

Are suspended baby jumpers like the Jolly Jumper safe?

Personally, both of my kids loved the jolly jumper from the start and would giggle almost the entire time they are in it.

Over the years, there have been discussions about the possible dangers of suspended baby jumpers. One concern I have heard is that as their name implies they are literally supportive and therefore decrease the stimulus on bones and muscles. In contrast, activities like tummy time (placing a baby on their stomach when they are awake) and other forms of free play help the baby develop strong neck, shoulder and promote motor skills like crawling. There has also been concern that the positioning of legs in certain jumpers can affect the development of the hips. In addition for some enthusiastic jumpers (like my son George) there is a risk that while swinging freely in the doorway from side to side they can pinch their fingers or knock their head into the door frame.

The American Academy of Pediatrics states that “infants who spend too much time in confining equipment such as car seats, swings, bouncy seats, exersaucers, or strollers may experience delayed motor skill development.”
Health Canada also recommends that if a infant is using a suspended baby jumper that the infant is always supervised, that the manufacturer’s recommendations (age, weight, physical abilities of the baby, dimensions and strength of door frame) are followed, and that the jumper is adjusted to the babies height.

👶🏻What Do We Do?
Both of my children loved jumping in their baby jumper and do so a few times a week. I will also admit that I find the jumper a bit of a sanity saver! When we use the jumper, I make sure I am close by and watching and limit the use to no more than 10 minutes at a time once per day.

What are your thoughts on suspended baby jumpers?

Impetigo is a contagious bacterial skin infection. It most commonly occurs in children under the age of 5.  Because it is contagious, it can spread to other areas of the body or to other people easily.  
It can spread when someone touches an impetigo rash, or through items that have been in contact with infected skin.

✳️What Causes Impetigo?
Impetigo is caused by bacteria, usually Group A Streptococcus (strep) or Staphylococcus aureus (staph).  These are normal bacteria that normally live on the skin – but they can become problematic when they get into scrapes or even bug bites.  In some cases, impetigo can occur when the skin is irritated by a runny nose.  
It occurs the most during warm sunny months.  This is when kids are playing outside more and end up with more bumps and scrapes, and itchy insect bites.

✳️Signs And Symptoms 
Impetigo causes blister-like sores or red pimples. It usually appears around the mouth, nose, and skin not covered by clothes like arms or legs.  Eventually the blisters may start to ooze or crust-over with a yellowish scab.  
Parents need to watch out for signs of a more serious infection like fever, pain, swelling, or feeling weak.  This could be a sign that the infection is more serious than just a skin problem.

✳️Treatment Of Impetigo
Impetigo needs to be treated with antibiotics. In some cases, your doctor will use a topical cream or ointment to apply to the skin while in other cases, an oral antibiotic is required.  Call your doctor if you think your child has impetigo.

🛑If your child has impetigo:
* Keep the sores covered with a dressing until they are healed
* Wash your hands well with soap and water, especially after touching the skin
* Do not share facecloths or towels between family members
* Make sure your child finishes the course of antibiotics prescribed
* Keep your child’s nails trimmed so they don’t scratch their skin

🍎 How to get your kids to eat more fruits and veggies? 🥕 

Here are 3 simple ways to encourage your kids to taste something new this summer:

1️⃣ Create a shared place for eating.
— Kids learn from one another. When they see a friend trying something new…they often feel brave too!

2️⃣ Let them build their own plate and have an assortment of fruits and veggies that they can choose from 
— Family-style meals keep parents in charge of what’s on the menu, but empower kids to eat to their mood and personality. Food autonomy builds trust and openness to eating!

3️⃣ Add fruits or veggies to existing favourites. 
For example, topping cereal with fruit, adding fruit to pancakes or yogurt or adding veggies to burgers!

🥒 Anything else you find helpful for getting your kids to eat more fruits and veggies?

Also, thank you to my friend and dietitian @getjoyfull for the picky eating tips!

Why is it harder to sleep during your period (menstruation)? 😴 

Many women will note that their menstral cycle affects their sleep in someway. Difficulty sleeping due to cramps, headache and bloating can occur during menstral cycle. Days leading up to your mensural cycle some women may notice not only physical symptoms but also emotional changes like increased anxiety and irritability that can lead to insomnia. Hormonal fluctuations, can contribute to difficulties in falling asleep or maintaining sleep during this time.

🛌 How to improve our sleep during menstral cycle?

Sleep difficulty can start days leading up to your period. It is recommend to optimize sleep hygiene prior to your periods such as consistent wake up time, getting exposure to daylight, and developing a relaxing bedtime routine.

In general, exercise and hydration and pain management with ibuprofen can be beneficial for menstral symptoms.

Sleeping with absorbent pads or a mattress protector as this can help provide peace of mind for those worried about stains overnight. If sleep disturbances persist or significantly impact your daily functioning, please see your healthcare provider.

Can teething cause a fever?👇

Teething is a normal process of new teeth working their way through the gums. The most common symptoms of teething are: gum irritation, irritability, and increased drooling. 

Sometimes babies can have a mild increase in body temperature when teething. However, do not confuse this with a true fever, which is when the temperature is greater than 38°C. 

If a fever persists, please see your care provider to rule out other causes of fever such as ear infections or urinary tract infections.

Each baby will learn to coordinate and balance at different rates! Some babies will learn to walk at 8 months while others may start closer to 18 months. There is a wide range of normal! My son, George learned to walk when he was 11 months old and I still remember this day vividly even though it was almost 3 years ago!

With the help of Paediatric PT @drivingdevelopment we outline when you should check in with your care provider if your little one isn’t walking:

🧑‍⚕️ We recommend that checking in with your care provider if your little one is not walking by 17 months or earlier if your 12 month old is displaying any of the following: 

🛑 The presence of any other delays (speech, fine motor or feeding)
🛑 No form of independent mobility (e.g. crawling, bottom shuffle)
🛑 Not pulling to stand
🛑 Only using one side of body
🛑 Unable to sit independently without support
🛑 Standing with with marked abnormal foot position (e.g. intoeing)

Are you concerned about your child’s speech but not sure when to seek help from a speech-language pathologist? 

Here are a few signs to look out for:

-At 12 months, child has limited babbling, not gesturing, not responding to their name 

-At 15 months, child has 0 words, not pointing, has difficulty understanding/responding to “no”

-At 18 months, child is not producing between 10-50 words, has difficulty following simple commands 

-At 24 months, not combining words, producing under 50 words 

Keep in mind these are just a few things to look out for, as there are many other factors involved. 
Also, this does not necessarily mean that if your child isn’t doing one of these, then they certainly have a speech delay. There are a lot of areas that need to be assessed, so if you are truly concerned it’s best to follow your gut and seek a speech evaluation. 

Don’t “wait and see”, early intervention is 🔑!!! Questions? Comment below!

Follow @gracefulexpression.slp for speech tips & @lifeofdrmom for maternal and child health info.

Sunburn is an inflammatory reaction of the skin to the harmful UV rays of the sun. Sunburns can range from mild redness to blistering. Here are some do’s and don’ts for managing sunburns

✅Do’s 
* DO drink lots of fluids to stay hydrated. Burns draw fluid to the skins surface and away from the rest of your body and you may become dehydrated.
* DO take medications like acetaminophen and ibuprofen (only if over 6 months of age) for pain.
* DO use cold compresses and take cold baths or showers to relieve the pain.
* DO apply @bydrmom Beta-Glucan cream to help sooth the skin. Beta-Glucan helps to accelerate the healing process (Reference: Delatte et al. J Pediatr Surg. 2001)
* DO take extra care to protect sunburned skin by patting dry your skin after baths and staying out of the sun until your skin is healed.
*DO avoid further sunburns by protecting your skin with sunscreen, hats and limiting sun exposure during peak hours. Sunburns increase your risk of skin cancer!

❌Don’t
* DON’T use soaps that might irritate your skin
* DON’T use petroleum or oil based ointments as they may trap the heat and make the burn worst
* DON’T pick at peeling skin, allow the dead skin sheets to detach on their own
* DON’T pop blisters, blisters form to help your skin heal and protect you from infection

✳️Please see your health care provider if there is blistering over a large portion of the body, fever, confusion, feel unwell or there are concerns about dehydration.

Anything else you do that helps when you get a sunburn?

Learn how to stop a nosebleed 👇

✳️Don’t pinch the bridge of your nose, this won’t help!

✳️Pinch the soft area towards the bottom of the nose (nasal alae).

✳️Tilt your head forward. This will drain blood into the nose instead of into the back of the throat.

✳️Squeeze your nose shut for at least 15 minutes. In children, squeeze for only 10 minutes. Do not realize the pressure until before the time is up. If you keep checking it will reduce the likelihood of the bleeding stopping.

✳️If bleeding persists or increases after the above steps are tried please see a healthcare provider!

It can be challenging to differentiate between the common cold and seasonal allergies as they can share some similar symptoms, but there are also some key differences.

❇️Duration of symptoms, allergies can last for weeks or months, while the common cold usually has a shorter duration, typically less than two weeks.
❇️Onset of symptoms is also a key feature, allergy symptoms appear immediately after exposure to allergens such as pollen. Cold symptoms can often present more gradually starting with a sore throat or stuffy nose and then progressing.
❇️Colour of nasal discharge also differs, with allergies, nasal discharge is usually clear and watery, while a common cold, the nasal discharge can be clear or thicker and discoloured.
❇️Common colds can often be associated with a fever, allergies are not.

Have you experienced seasonal allergies 🤧?

🧑‍⚕️ If you are still unsure of the symptoms, consult your doctor or local healthcare practitioner for further advice.

Cooking with a cast iron pan can increase the amount of iron in food👇

Cooking with a cast iron pan can increase the iron content in food, especially foods that are acidic or high in moisture!

When you cook in a cast iron pan, small amounts of iron from the pan can be transferred into the food during the cooking process. Acidic foods like tomatoes can increase the transfer of iron from the pan into the foods.

The amount of iron transferred to the food from cast iron varies depending on factors such as the cooking time, type of food that is being cooked and the cast iron pan itself. For example, a well seasoned pan will prevent food from sticking and enhances the iron transfer to food. In general, the longer the food is cooked in the pan, the more iron it absorbs.

It’s important to note that the increase in iron content is usually not significant enough to meet the recommended daily intake of iron on its own. However, it can contribute a small amount to your overall iron intake, which is beneficial to those who struggle getting adequate amounts of iron in their diet.

Did you know cooking with a cast iron pot can increase iron content in food?

Thrush, or oropharyngeal candidiasis, is a common infection in babies. It is a fungal infection caused by Candida that affects the mouth and throat.

Candida is found on the skin and in the body and usually does not cause any infections. But sometimes a baby can end up with thrush because they do not have a strong immune system yet.

✳️Signs And Symptoms Of Thrush 
The most common sign of a thrush infection is white plaques on the tongue, inside of the cheeks or on the roof of the mouth. The plaques cannot be easily wiped off.

Sometimes the mouth can become painful and cause infants to refuse to eat and swallow because of the pain. Occasionally, the baby may also have a Candida infection in the diaper area as well.

Breastfeeding mothers may also have a Candida infection of the nipples. They may complain of sore nipples or burning or shooting pain in the breasts.

✳️What Should I Do If I Think My Baby Has Thrush?
If you think your baby has thrush, they should be evaluated by their primary health care provider to determine if they require antifungal treatment.

All pacifiers, bottles and nipples, and toys should be washed with hot soapy water between uses to prevent a recurring infection.

Breastfeeding mothers may also require topical antifungal treatment to prevent an infection from being passed back and forth.

✳️Treatment Of Thrush
The most common prescription medicine for treatment of thrush in an infant is nystatin. Your primary health care provider will determine if this is the right medicine for your baby.

Symptoms usually start to improve within 2-3 days of starting nystatin. Treatment is usually 7-14 days total. You should make sure you finish the full course of treatment prescribed even if the white plaques are gone.

🤱 Breastfeeding may continue during treatment of thrush, unless you are otherwise directed not to do so.

➡️Thoughts👇

Why you should wear flip flops in change rooms and pools👇

I recommend wearing flip flops or shower sandals when walking in warm, moist areas like locker rooms, public showers, and pools. This can prevent you from catching foot fungus and plantar warts. Public pools and change rooms are high barefoot traffic areas, which make them great places for picking up germs through exposed skin. People with plantar warts on their feet will shed the virus onto the floor and the wet and warm environments of change rooms and pool floors is a perfect place for fungus to thrive.

🦶 What is foot fungus?

Foot fungus, also know as athletes foot causes the skin on the feet to become itchy, red, cracked, tender, and scaly.  Sometimes it also causes blisters to form. It often affects the skin between the toes. People who have foot fungus can often get a fungal infection on their toenails, this is also known as onchymycosis which causes the nail to turn white, yellow, or brown, become thick or break off easily.

🦶What are plantar warts?

Skin warts are growths on the skin that are caused by a virus called human papillomavirus (HPV). Warts on the bottom of the feet are called plantar warts. 

Plantar warts often begin as a small, round area of rough or thickened skin but may grow to involve larger areas. If you look closely, you might be able to see little black dots which are the small clogged blood vessels commonly seen in plantar warts.

Sleep hygiene is a set of actions prior to bedtime that tend to improve and maintain good sleep. @graememulhollandmd (sleep surgeon) and @lifeofdrmom (family doctor) recommend practicing sleep hygiene, but sometimes they don’t follow their own recommendations 🙈.

Here are some recommendations:
😴 The National Sleep Foundation recommends adults age 26-64 years old have 7-9 hours of sleep. 

😴 Maintain a regular sleep schedule, wake up the same time everyday, even on the weekend. (@graememulhollandmd is used to waking up early from residency and wakes up early before the kids. @lifeofdrmom uses her kids as alarm clocks on weekends and there are some weekends when the kids sleep in!)

😴 Try not to force sleep and go to bed only when tired.

😴 Avoid caffeinated beverages after lunch and alcohol near bedtime.

😴 Avoid smoking or other nicotine intake, particularly during the evening.

😴Make the bedroom environment suitable for sleep by reducing ambient light, turning off TV and radio.

😴Avoid screen time prior to bedtime. Try to not use screens within 2 hours of bedtime. (We are both bad at this as we often enjoy reading the news or checking out social media to unwind. However, we try to avoid checking emails an hour before bedtime as this can sometimes amp us up and lead us to work late).

😴 Resolve concerns or worries before bedtime. One suggestion I have heard is putting a pad of paper by your bedside table and writing the concerns down so that the worries can be addressed the following day.

😴Exercise regularly for at least 20 minutes, preferably more than four to five hours prior to bedtime.

😴Avoid daytime naps, especially if they are longer than 20 to 30 minutes or occur late in the day.

How is your sleep hygiene?

The wildfires throughout Canada has resulted in poor air quality in many parts of Canada. When air quality is poor, it is safest to stay indoors. My kids love picnics during the summers, but this summer we have transitioned to indoor picnics on days when air quality is poor. The kids still love indoor picnics!

🧺 Here are some of our favourite tips for indoor picnics: 
✳️Get a large comfy blanket and some pillows.
Invite some “friends” aka stuffs.
✳️Lay out your favourite snacks. I find my kids are more open to trying new foods when we picnic so I make sure to have lots of different types of fruits and veggies

🧺 My favourite snack ideas:
✳️Cut up watermelon, our entire family loves watermelon, so refreshing and yummy!
✳️Cut up carrots, celery, cucumbers and peppers. I like having two dips to make it interactive, my two go-to dips are hummus and tzatziki.
✳️Cherries and strawberries are two of my favourite summer fruits. 
✳️Lay out nuts, crackers and cheeses are easy and look pretty together!
✳️For a sweet treat, I slice apples and top them with peanut butter and a few pieces of dark chocolate.

How to safely introduce peanuts to your baby👇

🥜 Introducing peanut products to infants is becoming more common as studies have shown early introduction can reduce the risk of developing a peanut allergy. When introducing peanuts to your baby it’s important that it be done safely.

🥜 Peanuts and peanut butter can be choking hazards for babies. The thick nature of peanut butter is what make it a potential choking risk. To reduce the risk, thin peanut butter out with water, breast milk, formula, or purées like applesauce and finely grind peanuts to sprinkle on other food. My favourite way to thin peanut butter was mixing it with breast milk or formula.

Did you know peanuts and peanut butter were choking risks for babies?

Did you know dilute apple juice is a great way to rehydrate?

🍎 Dilute apple juice is an effective way to rehydrate children as it contains the ideal amount of glucose for rehydration and children like the taste of it! Too much glucose can lead to further dehydration so the dilution is important!

In fact, a study published in 2016 (JAMA) found dilute apple juice is an effective rehydration solution for children with mild gastroenteritis (stomach bug) and mild dehydration.

Now imagine if a rehydration drink was developed using real apple juice and essential electrolytes were added to further help the rehydration process?

Introducing Pomme MD 🍎 🧑‍⚕️ 

As parents we wanted to provide our family with fluids that effectively hydrate our body. Many rehydration formulas contain artificial sweeteners and additives. We created Pomme MD because we wanted a natural rehydration formula with essential electrolytes.

The taste of apple is a taste of home and comfort, its satisfying refreshing and sweet taste is loved by the entire family. Apples are a fruit that is rich in in vitamins and minerals such as B vitamins, C, E, K and calcium, phosphorus, zinc and iron.

Family doctor @lifeofdrmom and surgeon @soundasleepmd teamed up with farmers @freshbcfruit to create a natural apple juice based rehydration formula to keep you hydrated during times of illness, sport or in the heat.
 
Instead of using artificial sugars, we obtained our sweetness from only quality Okanagan apples. Many years of research through the World Health Organization has found sodium, potassium and citrate essential in combination with glucose as essential in rehydration during times of need.
 We have added high grade essential electrolytes in addition to only real apple juice to create Pomme MD, natures rehydration with essential electrolytes. 
 
From us to you,
Steve, Dan and Sabrina Souto @freshbcfruit
Dr. Stephanie Liu @lifeofdrmom

How many wet diapers should a newborn have per day?

Six or more!

During the first few days of life a newborn will have less wet diapers.

1️⃣2️⃣3️⃣
On day 1 you can expect at least one wet diaper, then day 2 you can expect at least 2 wet diapers and then day 3 you should expect at least 3 wet diapers! After the first few days they should have 6 or more wet diapers per day!

🥵 How to stay cool while you sleep WITHOUT air con?

We don’t have air conditioning at our house and some summer nights can get so hot! We have found these tips helpful to keep us cool overnight:

✳️Freeze your pillowcases can be a good way to cool you down at bedtime: place your pillowcase in the freezer in the evening and put it on your pillow before getting into bed
✳️Draw the curtains. Keeping sunlight out of your bedroom will help your sleep area stay cool. Draw the curtains or shades in the morning and do not open them until you go to bed. I find blackout curtains work well to keep the bedrooms cool.
✳️Natural fiber sheets like cotton offer better better breathability than those made from polyester and other synthetic fabrics.
✳️Find your ideal clothing level: Light cotton fabric Pajamas work well or for some, people prefer sleeping nude or semi-nude. Avoid thick, insulating PJs that can cause you to overheat!
✳️Bedside fans can help circulate air through your room to help you stay cool.

I used to fear getting older because I worried about the physical changes of aging. But now I realize that I am lucky to age as that means I am able to spend more time with the ones I love.

🔵 “Blue zones” and longevity

Blue zones are regions in the world where people are speculated to live longer, happier and healthier lives than average. These areas are all in different parts of the world (Okinawa, Japan; Sardinia, Italy; Nicoya, Costa Rica; Ikaria, Greece, and Loma Linda, California) but they found some commonality in these regions.

Longevity tips from the “Blue Zones”👇

🚶‍♀️Movement throughout their day. Movement is part of their daily life - walking, growing gardens, chores around the home. 

❤️Purpose - Knowing your sense of “why I wake up in the morning”

😌Downshift - stress is inevitable in life, but in routines that help shed stress such s a few movements to remember ancestors, prayers, nap or for some, happy hour!

🥘 80% rule - stop eating when you are 80% full.

🥗 Eat lots of plants - veggies and fruits are good for us.

🤝Belonging - denomination doesn’t matter but some find benefit with attending faith based services.

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦Loved ones first - put family first, caring for our elderly, commit to life partner, invest in children with time and love.

👯‍♀️Right tribe -find friends that support healthy behaviours.

🦶 What’s the difference between skin foot fungus (athletes foot) and nail fungus (onychomycosis)?

Foot fungus, also know as athletes foot causes the skin on the feet to become itchy, red, cracked, tender, and scaly.  It often affects the skin between the toes. People who have foot fungus can often get a fungal infection on their toenails, this is also known as onchymycosis which causes the nail to turn white, yellow, or brown, become thick or break off easily.

🦶 How to treat foot fungus?

Foot fungus on the skin responds to most topical antifungal treatments, many of which are available without a prescription. It is harder to treat foot fungus on the toenails. That is why it is recommended that your doctor sure take a small sample of the nail to confirm fungus is the cause of your nail becoming discoloured. Over-the-counter creams or products for nail fungus don’t usually don’t work. Treatment depends, in part, on how severe the infection is, and how much it bothers you. When people need or choose to have treatment, it usually involves antifungal medicines that you get with a prescription from your doctor. It’s important to discuss the risks and benefits of treatment with your doctor before starting treatment.

🧑‍⚕️ Please see your health care provider if you are unsure if you have a fungal infection or if you notice your skin or nail changes are progressing.

Sunburn is an inflammatory reaction of the skin to the harmful UV rays of the sun. Sunburns can range from mild redness to blistering. Don’t do the following if you have a sunburn👇

❌Don’t
* DON’T use soaps that might irritate your skin
* DON’T use petroleum or oil based ointments as they may trap the heat and make the burn worst
* DON’T pick at peeling skin, allow the dead skin sheets to detach on their own
* DON’T pop blisters, blisters form to help your skin heal and protect you from infection

If have a sunburn consider doing the following:

✅Do’s 
* DO drink lots of fluids to stay hydrated. Burns draw fluid to the skins surface and away from the rest of your body and you may become dehydrated.
* DO take medications like acetaminophen and ibuprofen (only if over 6 months of age) for pain.
* DO use cold compresses and take cold baths or showers to relieve the pain.
* DO apply @bydrmom Beta-Glucan cream which helps skin healing and hydration. This will help ease the discomfort. 
* DO take extra care to protect sunburned skin by patting dry your skin after baths and staying out of the sun until your skin is healed.
* DO try to prevent getting sunburns! Prevention!!

✳️Please see your health care provider if there is blistering over a large portion of the body, fever, confusion, feel unwell or there are concerns about dehydration.

🛌 Why you need to get out of bed if you can’t sleep?

If you have not fallen asleep after 20 to 30 minutes of turning out the lights and snuggling up in bed, it is recommended you get up from the bed, exit the room, and do a non-stimulating task like reading a relaxing book in a low-light area.  Then after 20 to 30 minutes, re-enter the bedroom and try to go back asleep again. 

🛌 Lying awake in bed for a prolonged period of time can create a negative connection between your bed and sleep!

💤 Here are some other tips that are helpful for improving and maintaining sleep:

😴 Maintain a regular sleep schedule, wake up the same time everyday, even on the weekend. L
😴 Try not to force sleep and go to bed only when tired.
😴 Avoid caffeinated beverages after lunch and alcohol near bedtime.
😴 Avoid smoking or other nicotine intake, particularly during the evening.
😴Make the bedroom environment suitable for sleep by reducing ambient light, turning off TV and radio.
😴Avoid screen time prior to bedtime. Try to not use screens within 2 hours of bedtime. (We are both bad at this as we often enjoy reading the news or checking out social media to unwind. However, we try to avoid checking emails an hour before bedtime as this can sometimes amp us up and lead us to work late).
😴 Resolve concerns or worries before bedtime. One suggestion I have heard is putting a pad of paper by your bedside table and writing the concerns down so that the worries can be addressed the following day.
😴Exercise regularly for at least 20 minutes, preferably more than four to five hours prior to bedtime.
😴Avoid daytime naps, especially if they are longer than 20 to 30 minutes or occur late in the day.

Heat exhaustion occurs when your child is hot, sweats a lot, and does not drink enough to replace the lost fluids. 
Symptoms of heat exhaustion include:
* Heavy sweating
* Cold, pale, and clammy skin
* Fast, weak pulse
* Nausea or vomiting
* Muscle cramps
* Tiredness or weakness
* Dizziness
🚨 It is very important to recognize heat exhaustion right away as if left untreated it can progress to heat stroke, a medical emergency. 

Children with symptoms of heat exhaustion should be moved to a cooler place, extra clothing removed, and given cold fluids to slowly sip on. You can even place cool, wet cloths on their body or have a cool bath. Contact your doctor if your child is experiencing these symptoms.

👩🏻‍⚕️ How to prevent heat related illness?
*Drink plenty of fluids
*Wear light coloured loose clothing
*Hat with brims to reflect the sun
*Avoid strenuous activity during the hottest part of the day (11-2pm)
*Cars can get very hot, open windows or turn on airconditioner before child gets in

My favourite vitamin is vitamin D! People of all ages, from baby to adulthood people should be supplementing with vitamin D. This is why👇
 
Vitamin D is most well known for bone health, but more research is showing that it has multiple other functions. We need it for the cells in our body to work properly. Studies have shown that vitamin D deficiency has been linked to osteoporosis, asthma and autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, multiple sclerosis, inflammatory bowel disease, and diabetes. There is still much more to discover about vitamin D.

👶🏻Babies need vitamin D
 Babies need vitamin D for healthy growth and development, it helps them build strong bones and teeth.  Babies that don’t get enough vitamin D are at risk of rickets, a disease that affects the way bones grow and develop. 

The Canadian Paediatric Society recommends breastfed babies receive 400 International Units (IU) daily. However, babies in northern communities or who have other risk factors (such as dark skin) should get 800 IU per day between October and April, when there is less sunlight.

Infant formula is fortified with vitamin D.  Ask your physician if you should give additional supplementation to your baby.

👧🏻 👦🏻 👨 👩 🧓 
Vitamin D supplementation should continue into childhood and adulthood. The recommended dose is 400IU, some people may need more.

Does breast size reflect how much breastmilk you will produce?

Breast size does not correlate with how much breast milk can be produced. The size of your breasts is based upon the amount of fatty tissue that is contained within them, but it is the glandular tissue in breasts that produces the breast milk. 

People with all different breast sizes are fully capable of producing a healthy supply of breast milk for their babies.

Breast milk supply is not determined by the size or shape of your breasts but instead by how much and how often your baby feeds. If you want to produce more breast milk, try increasing the frequency of breastfeeding or pumping.  Consider utilizing the expertise of a lactation consultant.

Sleep problems during pregnancy are common, in fact, at least 50 percent of pregnant moms experience insomnia at some point in their pregnancy. There are many factors that lead to difficulty sleeping during pregnancy such as fluctuating hormone levels, general physical discomfort, nausea, increased urination and leg cramps to name a few. As time wears on, expectant mothers may also experience back pain and have trouble finding a comfortable position to accommodate the growing baby bump, especially when the baby starts to kick at night. If you are experiencing difficulty sleeping try👇

Starting with good sleep hygiene such as keeping a consistent wake up time, and a relaxing bedtime routine.

Next, is finding a comfortable sleep environment such as a cool, dark, quiet room.

Finding a comfortable sleep position, I recommend the lying on your left side with your legs slightly curled and I liked having a pregnancy pillow to support my belly and to put in between my legs.

If you are experiencing heartburn or indigestion, try eating smaller and more frequent meals throughout the day and avoid heavy or spicy foods close to bedtime.

Getting exercise during the day can also help improve your sleep.

❤️If sleep disturbances persist or significantly impact your daily functioning, see your healthcare provider.

Breastfeeding was one of the things I looked forward to most when I was pregnant. In medical school I learned about the bond between mothers and babies when they are breastfeeding. I could not wait to experience this.

However, breastfeeding Madi turned out to be more challenging than I anticipated. I struggled to get her to latch and when she did latch it was very painful. As a result, my milk supply was insufficient. For the first two weeks, I supplemented with formula and was racked with guilt that I was not doing the best for Madi.

My experience with breastfeeding changed how I interact with my patients that struggle to breastfeed their infants. Rather than only doing the initial screen looking for physical causes of difficult breastfeeding, I now ask ‘How is difficulty breastfeeding affecting you?’

I ask this question because I felt like an inadequate mother when I was not able to breastfeed, but was too ashamed to talk about it. Since starting to ask this question, I have had patients express concern that they may have symptoms of postpartum depression (PPD) or felt like a horrible mother for being unable to breastfeed.

Are women who struggle with breastfeeding at an increased risk of PPD? Let’s examine the evidence.

There is recent evidence that suggests women with difficulty breastfeeding may be at risk for postpartum depression. One large study of over 2,500 women found that women who had negative breastfeeding experiences were more likely to have symptoms of depression:
‘Compared with women with no early neonatal signs of breastfeeding difficulty, we found that women who had negative feelings about breastfeeding and reported severe pain while nursing soon after birth were more likely to experience postpartum depression at two months.’ 

As parents, we intend to provide the best for our babies, so difficulty breastfeeding may lead to significant amounts of stress.

As a family doctor, I know that breast milk is the optimal feeding choice for health benefits, but as a mom, I know the extreme pressures that we are placed under as women to produce milk every time our baby needs it.

Choose what works for you and your family ❤️

Did you know that balance is a predictor of longevity?

A study found that inability to stand unsupported on one leg for 10 seconds was associated with an 84% increased risk of death.

We know that balance quickly diminishes after the mid-50s increasing the risk for falls and other adverse health outcomes. A study published in the BMJ in 2022 found that the inability to stand unsupported on one leg for 10 seconds was associated with an 84% heightened risk of death from any cause within the next decade.

The study included 1702 participants aged 51–75 (average of 61). Participants were asked to stand on one leg for 10 seconds without any additional support. Up to three attempts on either foot were permitted.

In all, around 1 in 5 (20.5%; 348) participants failed to pass the test. The inability to stand on one leg increased with age.

Chafing in sensitive areas caused by sweat and friction can be uncomfortable and irritating. It occurs where any parts of your body rub together. Thigh and groin chafing are two common areas where chafing occur and is often worse in hot weather.

Fortunately, there are several preventive measures and treatments you can try to alleviate or avoid chafing:

✳️Clean the affected area with mild soap and water. After you clean the area apply a thin layer of a topical, like petroleum jelly that can provide a protective barrier
✳️Wear moisture-wicking and breathable fabrics
✳️Avoid very tight or very loose clothing that can increase friction in sensitive areas.

People and animals suffer heat-related illness when the body’s temperature control system is overloaded. Heat illness can potentially be life threatening. 

Tips to prevent heat illness in humans and pets👇

☀️ Have an area to cool down: Make sure your child and pet always has access to a cool shaded area, both indoors and outside.
☀️ Avoid strenuous activity during the hottest part of the day (11-2pm).
☀️Encourage consumption of lots of fluids. Ensure you always have a water bottle when out!
☀️ Watch out for hot objects or pavement: Car seat buckles can be hot for little ones and dogs can burn paws on pavement! If it’s to hold your hand on, it’s too hot for your pet to walk on or your child to sit in!
☀️Never leave children or pets in a hot car unattended.
☀️ Dress or be groomed appropriately: have your child wear light coloured loose clothing and hats with brims to reflect the sun. Ensure your pet is regularly groomed if this is advised for their breed

Tennis elbow, is a common condition that causes pain and inflammation in the outer part of the elbow (lateral epicondylitis). Tennis elbow can result from playing tennis, but it can also affect anyone who repeatedly uses their forearm muscles. It often occurs due to overuse or repetitive movements of the forearm and wrist such as repetitive twisting and gripping in painting or carpentry
 
The main symptom of tennis elbow is pain and tenderness on the outside of the elbow. The pain may radiate down the forearm or up the arm and worsen when performing activities that involve gripping or lifting. Weakness in the affected arm and difficulty with wrist movements can also be experienced.

How to treat it?
Treatment for tennis elbow focuses on relieving pain, reducing inflammation, and promoting healing. Common treatments include:
✳️Rest: Avoiding activities that exacerbate the pain can help the elbow heal.
✳️Pain relievers such as ibuprofen can help manage pain and reduce inflammation.
✳️Arm brace can also be helpful as it can help reduce the strain on the injured tendon. 
✳️Physical therapy: Specific exercises can help strengthen the forearm muscles and improve flexibility, which can aid in recovery.

One stretching exercise I like for tennis elbow is hold your injured arm straight out, and point your fingers down to the ground. Use your other hand (with the thumb pressing on the palm) to grab this hand. Then, press down on the back of the hand to bend the wrist more. Hold this position for 30 seconds. Repeat the stretch 3 times. Do this exercise 1 time a day.

 If pain persists. Please see your health care provider❤️

Many women during pregnancy (including myself) feel more tired. This can be due to a  combination of physical, hormonal, and emotional changes during pregnancy. Here are some of the reasons a momma to be may feel more tired:
✳️Hormonal Changes: During pregnancy, there is a significant fluctuations in hormones that can affect sleep patterns.
✳️Increased Energy Expenditure to support the growing baby.
✳️Emotional Changes: Pregnancy often comes with a range of emotional changes that can negatively affect sleep.
✳️Sleep Disturbances due to pregnancy. The physical changes, frequent urination can lead to poor quality sleep.
✳️Physical strain due to increased weight. Carrying extra weight can lead to muscle fatigue and overall tiredness.
✳️Increased iron requirements during pregnancy. Some pregnant women may develop iron-deficiency anemia, which can cause fatigue due to reduced oxygen-carrying capacity of the blood.

Can getting enough sleep help prevent weight gain? 🛌 

Studies have suggested that lack of sleep and poor sleep may increase the risk of obesity. It isn’t fully understood yet as to why this occurs.  One common hypothesis about the connection between weight and sleep involves how sleep affects appetite. Appetite is controlled by neurotransmitters, chemical messengers that allow nerve cells to communicate with each other. Two important neurotransmitters, ghrelin (promotes hunger) and leptin (contributes to feeling full) are key players in managing our appetite.

In one small study, (Ann Intern Med. 2004.) men who were sleep deprived had increased ghrelin and decreased leptin compared to those who had adequate amount of sleep. This dysregulation of ghrelin and leptin may lead to increased appetite and diminished feelings of fullness in people who are sleep deprived.

Some say that if you sleep less you will have more time for physical activity and burning calories, but studies actually show either no increase or very small increases in energy expenditure with sleep deprivation. There is even a tendency towards reduced physical activity due to fatigue (Metabolism 2018). 

In addition, several studies have also indicated that sleep deprivation affects food 
preferences. Sleep-deprived individuals tend to choose foods that are high in calories and carbohydrates.

Less physical activity combined with the increased calorie intake associated with sleep deprivation increases the risk of obesity.

Itchy skin during pregnancy is a common symptom and can be caused by a variety of factors. Some causes include:

✳️Stretching Skin: With the growing pregnancy, the skin over the abdomen, breasts, and thighs stretches, which can lead to itching.
✳️Hormonal Changes leading to dry skin: Hormonal fluctuations during pregnancy can affect the skin’s oil glands and moisture balance, potentially leading to dryness and itching.
✳️Pruritic Urticarial Papules and Plaques of Pregnancy (PUPPP): PUPPP is a skin condition that typically develops in the third trimester and causes itchy red bumps and hives on the abdomen, thighs, and buttocks.
✳️Stress and Anxiety: Pregnancy can bring about stress and anxiety, which might exacerbate skin conditions like eczema.
✳️Cholestasis of Pregnancy: This is a liver disorder that occurs during pregnancy and can lead to itching, especially on the hands and feet. It’s caused by a buildup of bile acids in the blood. This is a serious medical condition and must be followed by a health care provider. The itching will not resolve unless the underlying condition is treated. 

🧑‍⚕️ Our By Dr Mom can help be soothing and hydrating for irritated pregnancy skin. It is safe in pregnancy, steroid free and contains a natural active ingredient Beta-Glucan. Beta-Glucan a fiber that improves skin healing and hydration 

It’s important to note that while mild itching is usually considered normal during pregnancy, severe or persistent itching should be discussed with a healthcare provider. Please see your care provider immediately if the itching skin is accompanied by other symptoms, such as jaundice (yellowing of the skin or eyes), dark urine, as these could indicate a more serious underlying condition that requires medical attention.

🍎 The essential electrolytes in Pomme MD
Our rehydration solution contains the essential electrolytes for rehydration based on the World Health Organization recommendations: sodium, potassium and citrate! Sodium and Potassium are need to replace the body losses during illness or from sweating. Sodium is also very important in hydration. When you consume a hydration beverage with sodium the sodium is absorbed and water follows thus helping replenish losses in blood, muscles and tissues.

During times of vomiting and diarrhea, the acid base balance of our blood can change leading to increased acidity which can be harmful.  Citrate helps normalize the acid base balance in our blood.

🍎 No artificial sweeteners 

Unlike the naturally occurring sugars found in PommeMD, artificial sweeteners play no role in supporting hydration. Furthermore, artificial sweeteners are non-nutritive, meaning they offer no energy or nutritional value. While widely found in the food supply, the lack of research with human subjects is enough to cause pause with respect to safety. While many studies have shown that many sweeteners are safe, there’s still no clear consensus among the scientific community, and concerns persist. More evidence is needed. The majority of studies have been short in duration, animal-based and not indicative of real life conditions or doses.

The combination of electrolytes and real sugars from apples makes @pomme.md rehydration drink optimal for hydrating children, adults, elderly and breastfeeding moms!

What is a pap smear and how is a speculum used?👇

Screening for cervical cancer is done with a Pap test to identify abnormal changes in the cells of your cervix caused by viruses such as Human Papilloma Virus (HPV). Screening is important as it will allow for early detection which can prevent the abnormal cells from developing into cancer.

What to expect from your Pap test👇 
✳️A Pap test is done to look for changes in the cells of the cervix (lower part of uterus that leads to vagina).
✳️You will be provided with a drape to cover the lower half of your body.
✳️You’ll lie down on your back with your knees bent and heels rested in supports.
✳️The care provider will gently insert a speculum into the vagina to visualize the cervix and collect sample with a soft brush.

Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) is a common sleep-related breathing disorder. People with obstructive sleep apnea repeatedly stop and start breathing while they sleep. OSA causes fragmented sleep and contributes to severe health consequences if left untreated such as high blood pressure and heart disease. OSA is also associated with an increased risk of traffic accidents and work-related injuries.

The STOP-Bang questionnaire is a useful screening tool to screen for OSA consisting of 4 self-reportable (STOP: snoring, tiredness, observed apnea, and high blood pressure) and 4 demographic (Bang: body mass index [BMI, age, neck circumference, and gender)

A STOP-Bang score of 2 or less is considered low risk, and a score of 5 or more is high risk for having either moderate or severe OSA. For people who score 3 or 4, doctors may need to perform further assessment to determine how likely they are to have OSA.

Pregnant women are at increased risk of food poisoning because their immune system is weaker. If pregnant women get food poisoning, they are at risk of being sicker than non-pregnant people. The unborn baby can also get sick and do not have a developed immune system to fight off infection.

🍖 Deli Meats Can Be Contaminated With Listeria
Listeria monocytogenes are bacteria that can be sometimes found in foods you do not normally cook. It can also survive at fridge temperatures. Non-dried deli meats such as bologna, turkey breast, deli ham or roast beef are common examples of foods that can be contaminated with Listeria.

Safer deli meat options include: dried and salted meats like salami and pepperoni, or non-dried deli meats that are well heated and steaming hot.

Food contaminated by Listeria can cause gastroenteritis, or food poisoning.  Listeria accounts for less than 1% of reported cases of food poisoning. It usually starts within 24 hours of eating contaminated food.  Symptoms of food poisoning caused by Listeria are:
* Fever
* Watery diarrhea
* Nausea and vomiting
* Headache
* Muscle or joint aches

✳️Listeriosis
Listeriosis is a very rare but serious complication of infection caused by Listeria.  Listeriosis can cause meningitis or bacteremia (bacteria in the bloodstream). Listeria bacteria can go through the placenta and infect the unborn baby. This can cause miscarriage, premature birth or stillbirth, or make your baby very sick when they are born. Women in their third trimester are at the highest risk of Listeria infection.
Diagnosis of listeriosis is difficult.  The symptoms are very non-specific and can include:
* Fever
* Chills
* Back pain
* Flu-like illness
If there is any concern regarding listeriosis, see your health care provider urgently.

✳️Prevention!
Pregnant women should follow safe food practices:
* Read expiry dates
* Avoid cross-contamination between raw foods and cooked foods. 
* Do not store fresh or cooked meat and poultry products for more than 2-3 days in the refrigerator.
* Wash all raw fruit and vegetables thoroughly.
* Sufficient cooking or reheating of foods will destroy any micro-organisms; cook meats to 75°C.

It is hard to believe it is that time of year again… Back to School!

These are some tips I find helpful for the Back to School season.

1️⃣ Expect things to get messy. There is chaos in finding a new routine as kids return back to school -  organizing back packs and lunches, figuring out pickup and drop off, etc. If I expect things to be messy and a bit disorganized, like a disheveled home or kids papers everywhere it doesn’t stress me out as much! I know that as the weeks pass we will find our groove and things will get more organized.

2️⃣ Expect tears. I never understood what was so emotional about your child going into a different grade but once I became a parent I understood it and felt it. Our babies are growing up and although it’s exciting, it also reminds us that our babies are growing up FAST!

3️⃣ Know that you are doing your best and that’s enough. I forget things all the time for my kids school, so much so that last year I got in trouble at my son’s preschool 🙈. I felt like I was letting my kids down for not being organized and participating in the activities as much as I should be. It was only when I realized and accepted that I was doing my best and that is enough. My kids know I love them very much and that I am going to mess up throughout the year, they accept it and now so do I.

Both of my children had cradle cap when they were newborns. Cradle cap, or seborrheic dermatitis, is a relatively common skin condition that can affect infants between the ages of 2 weeks to 12 months. It occurs most commonly within the first 3 months of life.

👶🏻What Does Cradle Cap Look Like?
Infants will have thick white or yellow greasy scales on the scalp and forehead.  The scales can be slightly reddened at the bases.  Sometimes it can also appear around the nose, ears, or skin folds. Most infants are not bothered by cradle cap, as it is a benign inflammatory skin condition that often resolves spontaneously.  Sometimes it can cause mild itchiness.

👶🏻How Do You Treat Cradle Cap?
Because cradle cap usually resolves on its own within a few weeks to a few months, the initial recommendations are very conservative.  

Start with emollients such as mineral oil, baby oil, or petroleum jelly.  Apply the emollient to the scales to help loosen them and then use a cloth or infant hairbrush to remove them.

Hair and scalp can be washed regularly with a mild baby shampoo followed by brushing of scales to reduce flaking.  Infants generally do not require medicated creams or shampoos to treat cradle cap.  In some severe cases, physicians may prescribe antifungal creams or shampoos.  Your physician will determine if a steroid cream is required to treat your infant’s cradle cap.

Fortunately, both of my children’s cradle cap resolved after a few treatments with mineral oil.

🐶👶Does your dog make your baby laugh? 

🎯I asked Family Physician Dr. Stephanie Liu, MD MSc with @lifeofdrmom if there are medical benefits to having a dog.

🎯A ⁠recent study found that owning a dog is associated with a lower risk for food allergies in infants. In this study, owning a dog was associated with a 90% reduction in the odds of developing a food allergy. ⁠
⁠
👉Owning 2 or more dogs and greater interaction with the dog decreased the odds to an even greater extent. ⁠
⁠
⁠
The researchers speculated that, because infants with dogs at home are exposed to bacteria from the dog’s gut microbiome, they may have increased beneficial gut bacteria, which then decreases their chances of developing a food allergy. ⁠

______⁠

🎯In another study, the researchers followed 636 children at high risk for developing asthma, allergies, or eczema from birth until after their 4th birthdays. ⁠
⁠
👉When they examined which children had developed eczema by age 4, they found that children who were allergic to dogs were less likely to develop the skin condition if they had a dog in the home during their first year of life. ⁠

______⁠

🎯A study published in JAMA Pediatrics 2015 suggested that exposure to dogs and farm animals during the first year of life reduces the risk of asthma in children at age 6 years. ⁠

______⁠

⁠
🎯Another article published in 2015 in Preventing Chronic Disease explored whether pet dogs are positively associated with healthy weight and mental health in children. ⁠
⁠
👉This study suggests that having a pet dog in the home was associated with a decreased probability of childhood anxiety.⁠

Sleep is important for our overall health, it allows our body and mind to recharge. Family doctor (@lifeofdrmom) and ENT surgeon and sleep medicine physician (@graememulhollandmd ) team up to share the recommended amount of sleep by age👇

The amount of sleep that we need changes throughout our lifetime.

😴 These are the suggested total sleep requirements by the National Sleep Foundation:
* Newborn Sleep (0-3 months): 14-17 hours each day
* Infants Sleep (4-11 months): 12-15 hours each day
* Toddlers Sleep (1-2 years): 11-14 hours each day
* Preschoolers Sleep (3-5): 10-13 hours each day
* School age children Sleep (6-13): 9-11 hours each day
* Teenagers Sleep (14-17): 8-10 hours each day
* Younger adults Sleep (18-25): 7-9 hours each day
* Adults Sleep (26-64): 7-9 hours each day
* Older adults (65+): 7-8 hours each day

👶🏻👧🏻👦🏻Children from 0 – 4 years old will often have sleep that is divided between night time sleep, and day time napping.

🛌 Over the past few months, I’ve been better at making sleep a priority. I will admit that there are still some nights that I stay up too late working, but I’m really trying to have a consistent bedtime. Have you been getting enough sleep?

What Is “Mommy’s Thumb”?

“Mommy’s thumb” aka de Quervain tenosynovitis is a common cause of hand or wrist pain in adults.  It is sometimes called “mommy’s thumb” or “mommy’s wrist” because it seems to be more common in women especially during the newborn period.  It seems to present itself in the first 4 to 6 weeks after delivery. I had “mommy thumb” during my first month postpartum with Madi and with Georgie, it hurt!

The pain and discomfort usually affects the base of the thumb where it connects to the wrist. The pain is occurs most often with thumb movement that spreads down to the forearm. Sometimes there is swelling and tenderness.  It can affect both sides, but often is worse on one side than the other. It isn’t inflammation that causes the pain and discomfort. Rather it is overuse and repetitive movements that cause the pain.  
New moms are at higher risk because of the repetitive movements of lifting and holding newborns. Breastfeeding can also contribute due to the positioning of the hand and wrist for holding the newborn to the breast. Hormones and fluid retention may also be contributing factors.

✳️Will The Pain Ever Go Away?
The good news is that de Quervain’s tenosynovitis is generally self-limiting. This means that it will generally resolve on its own, usually within a year.  
In breastfeeding women who experience pain when positioning their infant, the pain usually subsides after they stop nursing.

✳️Treatment Of “Mommy’s Thumb”
Otherwise, in the meantime, the main goal is to relieve symptoms. Analgesics like NSAIDs and applying ice packs to the affected area may help. Physiotherapy can also be beneficial.

Your doctor may advise splinting the affected side.

If splinting and pain medicine doesn’t help, your doctor may also suggest a glucocorticoid injection. A steroid medication is injected into the tendon on the affected side. This can be very effective and long lasting pain relief. There are few side effects with this treatment.  

Surgery is generally not indicated for “mommy’s thumb” since it usually goes away on its own.

The 4 questions I ask myself before signing up for another extracurricular activity👇

1️⃣Is your child getting enough sleep. Sleep deprivation can lead to negative health and developmental outcomes. In fact, a study of teens who were sleep deprived had lower grades, lower mood, increased daytime sleepiness and behavioral problems. 

2️⃣Is there time for unstructured play? The American Academy of The American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) published an article on the importance of unstructured play in development. Play has been shown to enhance the brain’s structure and function. Play can also improve children’s ability to plan, organize and get along with other sand regulate emotions. Play enhance the parent and child relationship. Life gets busy and it can be hard to find time to find time to play, I try my best to spend 15-30 minutes on weeknights playing or being silly with my kids and I find its good for me too!

3️⃣Is there time for family dinners? In addition to improved academic performance, studies have also shown improved family relationships and decreased risk of substance abuse for teens. Eating together decreases the risk of childhood obesity, and the risk of eating disorders. The more frequent the family meals, the better the emotional health of the adolescent, according to a study of more than 26,000 Canadian teens between 11 and 15 years of age.

4️⃣Do I feel stressed out with the activities? There have been times I felt like I was constantly rushing from one activity to another and feeling stressed and this was when I realized it was too much for me.

Have you ever felt over scheduled with kids activities? I know I have in previous years!

This is how the test is performed👇

1. Grab a straight-backed chair (about 17 inches high) without arm supports.
2. Sit in the middle of the chair.
3. Cross your arms and grab the shoulder opposite each.
4. Keep your feet flat on the floor, back straight, and arms against your chest.
5. When you or someone else says “go,” stand fully, then sit back down again.
6. Count the number of times you can do this in 30 seconds. If you’re more than halfway to standing when the timer goes off, count it as a stand.

The more sit to stands a person can do indicated better endurance and leg strength. A low score on the test indicates an increased risk of falls—and falls are the leading cause of injury and injury-related death in older adults. These below average scores are correlated with an increased risk of falls.

* For those ages 60-64, a below average score is less than 14 for men, and less than 12 for women.
* For those ages 65-69, a below average score is less than 12 for men and less than 11 for women.
* For those ages 70-74, a below average score is less than 12 for men and less than 10 for women.
* For those ages 75-79, a below average score is less than 11 for men and less than 10 for women.
* For those ages 80-84, a below average score is less than 10 for men and less than 9 for women.
* For those ages 85-89, a below average score is less than 8 for both men and women.
* For those ages 90-94, a below average score is less than 7 for men and less than 4 for women.
